bioAsHtml: I started playing with Android in late 2010 as an embedded systems engineer, then I moved to the "Application Layer", publishing a few weekend projects. I approached Reactive Programming in 2013 and I started using it in Android thanks to RxJava by Netflix. I'm using it in every Android app I work on since then, because RxJava solves so many issues on Android and it gives you a new perspective about mobile programming. My personal most popular Android app is Kindle Gratis, a Kindle companion app with almost 100k downloads. I like Open Source projects. I'm a big fan of a lot of fancy Android libraries out there and I contribute with bug reporting, fixing and feedbacks. In 2013 I co-founded Alter Ego. In 2015 I published RxJava Essentials.
bio:
I started playing with Android in late 2010 as an embedded systems engineer, then I moved to the "Application Layer", publishing a few weekend projects.
I approached Reactive Programming in 2013 and I started using it in Android thanks to RxJava by Netflix. I'm using it in every Android app I work on since then, because RxJava solves so many issues on Android and it gives you a new perspective about mobile programming.
My personal most popular Android app is Kindle Gratis, a Kindle companion app with almost 100k downloads. I like Open Source projects. I'm a big fan of a lot of fancy Android libraries out there and I contribute with bug reporting, fixing and feedbacks.
In 2013 I co-founded Alter Ego. In 2015 I published RxJava Essentials.
